description.false:
True form search mode allows bot to directly select true form (evolved form if unit doesn't have true form) first without user manually selecting it. For example, searching `sodom` will give 3 forms of sodom, but being same unit, because all 3 forms contain word `sodom`. True form search mode filters out such overlapped unit, picking 3rd or 2nd form

You will have to call `-tf` parameter to activate this search mode when using `p!fs` command
description.true:
True form search mode allows bot to directly select true form (evolved form if unit doesn't have true form) first without user manually selecting it. For example, searching `sodom` will give 3 forms of sodom, but being same unit, because all 3 forms contain word `sodom`. True form search mode filters out such overlapped unit, picking 3rd or 2nd form

You won't need to call `-tf` parameter to activate this search mode when using `p!fs` command

alias.description: Get aliases by getting data from specified name
alias.parameter:
- `-f`
Set type ad Unit mode
- `-e`
Set type as Enemy mode
- `-s`
Set type as Stage mode
- `-stm`
Specify stage map's name, only available when type is stage mode
- `-mc`
Specify map collection's name, only available when type is stage mode
alias.tip: You have to specify type right next to command. For example, `p!al -f` or `p!al -e`. Then you have to specify name to search. Bot will give you registered aliases from search result

aliasAdd.description: Add alias from data which are gotten from specified name. **You can't use this command unless you have permission which are given directly from developer of PackPack**
aliasAdd.example:
`p!ala -e Ururun Wolf -> Ururun Doge`
`p!ala -s Floor 47 -stm Heavenly Tower -> F47`
aliasAdd.parameter:
- `-f`
Set type ad Unit mode
- `-e`
Set type as Enemy mode
- `-s`
Set type as Stage mode
- `-stm`
Specify stage map's name, only available when type is stage mode
- `-mc`
Specify map collection's name, only available when type is stage mode
aliasAdd.tip:
You have to specify type right next to command. For example, `p!ala -f` or `p!ala -e`. Then you have to specify name to search

You can specify alias name by typing `->`, there must be spaces between `->`. For example, `p!ala -u Ururun Wolf -> woof`, then alias name will be specified as `woof`

aliasRemove.description: Remove alias from data which are gotten from specified name. **You can't use this command unless you have permission which are given directly from developer of PackPack**
aliasRemove.example:
`p!alr -f Ururun Wolf -> Ururun Doge`
`p!alr -s Floor 47 -stm Heavenly Tower -> F47`
aliasRemove.parameter:
- `-f`
Set type ad Unit mode
- `-e`
Set type as Enemy mode
- `-s`
Set type as Stage mode
- `-stm`
Specify stage map's name, only available when type is stage mode
- `-mc`
Specify map collection's name, only available when type is stage mode
aliasRemove.tip:
You have to specify type right next to command. For example, `p!alr -f` or `p!alr -e`. Then you have to specify name to search

You can specify alias name by typing `->`, there must be spaces between `->`. For example, `p!alr -u Ururun Wolf -> woof`, then alias name will be specified as `woof`

animationAnalyzer.description: Analyze custom animation files. Type `c` to cancel analyzing process or will be expired 5 mins later. **Only Trusted can use this command because this command can potentially cause internal error with misusing**
animationAnalyzer.parameter:
- `-d`
Enable debug mode
- `-r` or `-raw`
Generate animation with mp4 format for high-res result
- `-a` or `-anim`
Decide number of maanim files which will be uploaded, 1 as default
- `-bc` or `-b`
Enables BC animation analyzer, it also enables mp4 generating mode automatically
- `-zombie` or `-z`
Enables zombie mode when BC animation analyzer mode is activated
- `-a` or `-apk`
Make bot use analyzed apk file instead, so you won't need to send files tediously
- `-en/jp/tw/kr`
Decide BC version when `-apk` mode is turned on
animationAnalyzer.tip: This command requires 4 things : Png, Imgcut, Mamodel, and Maanim file. If you upload one of these files, it will try to grab them and validate if these files have valid format. After getting all 4 files, it will generate gif/mp4 of analyzed animation

boosterEmoji.description: Add booster's special custom emoji. To use this command, moderators must set booster role via `p!idset` command. Only moderators can use this command because this command manage server's emoji. `boostere`, `bemoji`, or
boosterEmoji.tip:
Custom emoji system is that you allow boosters to have their own custom emoji until that user's server boost expires. This command can automate managing such custom emojis, so those emojis will automatically be removed if their boost ends

Emoji name can be anything, but it's better to remove spaces between name. Moderator has to upload image file together, and bot accepts only png/gif file

boosterEmojiRemove.description: Remove assigned custom booster emoji from booster member if possible. Only moderators can use this command because this command manages server's emoji
boosterEmojiRemove.parameter:
- `-l` or `-leave`
Make bot not remove custom booster emoji, and only remove assigned data of this booster member

boosterPin.description: If moderator allowed boosters to pin/unpin messages, they can make bot pin/unpin messages for them even though boosters don't have message manage permission. Message must be specified via either message ID, message link, or reply

boosterRole.description: Add booster's special custom role. To use this command, moderators must set booster role via `p!idset` command. Only moderators can use this command because this command manage server's role. `boosterr`, `brole`, or
boosterRole.example:
`p!br @memberNameExample "Name can be anything allowing " in middle" -h 8dd145`
`p!br @memberNameExample "Role name" -r 141 -g 209 -b 69`
boosterRole.parameter:
- `-h` or `-hex`
Decide color hex code of this booster role
- `-r` or `-red`
Decide red color in rgb of role color
- `-g` or `-green`
Decide green color in rgb of role color
- `-b` or `-blue`
Decide blue color in rgb of role color
boosterRole.tip:
Custom role system is that you allow booster to have their own custom role until server boost expires for that user. This command can automate managing such custom roles, so those roles will automatically be removed if their boost ends

Role name must be wrapped by " quotation marks. Color must be specified by either `-h` or `-r,-g,-b` parameter. If both are specified, `-h` will take higher priority

`-r,-g,-b` parameter must have 0~255 value, and `-h` must have 6 hex value, `-h` can have `#` at start

This command will be denied if member doesn't have booster role, or member already has assigned booster role

boosterRoleRemove.description: Remove assigned custom booster role from booster member if possible. Only moderators can use this command because this command manages server's role. `boosterrolerem`, `brremove`, `brrem`, or
boosterRoleRemove.parameter:
- `-l` or `-leave`
Make bot not remove custom booster role, and only remove assigned data of this booster member

calculator.description:
Calculate the equation that is provided. It supports functions blow

`Basic calculations`
`sin/cos/tan`
`csc/sec/cot`
`arcsin/arccos/arctan`
`arccsc/arcsec/arccot`
`ln/log/logN`
`sqrt/sqrtN`
`nPr/nCr`
calculator.example: `p!c ln(e) + sin(pi/2) * cos(pi/4) * sqrt(2) - log5(25) + cos(arcsin(1) * 2) + sqrt3(8)`
calculator.tip:
`logN` means log whose base is `N`, so if you want to perform log with base of 2, then you have to call something like `log2(4)`

Same for `sqrtN`, it's `sqrt`, but base is `N`, which is identical to `V^(1/N)` = `sqrtN(V)`. So if you want to perform `8^(1/3)`, then you have to call `sqrt3(8)`

When you write number and parenthesis, you really don't need to put `*` manually. For example, `2(2+5)` will give you `14` automatically

config.description: Adjust config, so bot can apply your preferences automatically
config.tip:
When you call this command, bot will show 5 things which can be adjusted : Language, Default level, Extra information, Unit, Compact embed, True form search mode, Treasure

**Language** - language is that you can make bot show text with difference supporting language

**Default level** - You can make bot apply specific level automatically without calling `-lv` parameter

**Extra information** - You can make bot always show extra information (catfruit evolve data for unit, ex stage data for stage, etc.) without calling `-e` parameter

**Unit** - You can make bot always use frame/second unit for time-related data automatically without calling `-s` parameter

**Compact embed** - In mobile discord, there's problem that bot floods the chat when showing stat embed. This config merges multiple fields into one field, compressing embed messages without calling `-c` parameter
config.tip2:
**True form search mode** - True form search mode allows bot to directly select true form (evolved form if unit doesn't have true form) first without user manually selecting it. For example, searching `sodom` will give 3 forms of sodom, but being same unit, because all 3 forms contain word `sodom`. True form search mode filters out such overlapped unit, picking 3rd or 2nd form

**Treasure** - If you have your own custom treasure, you can call `-tr` in `p!fs` command to see stats with considering your custom treasure. You can make bot always use this feature

differentiate.description: Get differentiated value by using numerical methods with provided formula and value. `diff` and
differentiate.example: `p!dx sin(x) -v [pi + 2]` [This will have same value of `cos(pi + 2)`]
differentiate.parameter:
- `-v` or `-value`
Define value, must be wrapped with square brackets (`[]`)
- `-s` or `-step`
Define step size, must be wrapped with square brackets (`[]`)
- `-f` or `-front`
Apply forward difference method algorithm
- `-c` or `-center`
Apply central difference method algorithm
- `-b` or `-back`
Apply backward difference method algorithm
differentiate.tip:
When you writing value or step size, you hve to wrap them with `[]` square brackets. For example, `[3]`, `[0]`, etc. Also, you can put calculator function as ell, such as `[sqrt(2)]`, `[2 * pi]`, etc.

Bot allows 3 types of algorithm for differentiation; Forward/Central/Backward Difference Method. Keep in mind that central one has O(h²), while others have O(h) accuracy

Deciding too small step size may rather result in bad accuracy. Default step size is 10⁻⁸

enemyStatAnalyzer.description: Analyze stats of unit's true form from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings quite heavy process and required basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command**
enemyStatAnalyzer.example: `p!esa -e 612 -s -m 200 -n Haniwanwan -c {[0], Test Data, false, false, false} -t {0, Test Trait} -p {[0, 1, 2], _0_% chance to do something to _1_ for _2_, [f, f, t], 0}`
enemyStatAnalyzer.parameter:
- `-e` or `-eid`
Decide ID of enemy
- `-s` or `-second`
Use second unit
- `-n` or `-name`
Decide custom name of enemy
- `-m`
Set magnification of this enemy
- `-p` or `-proc`
Add data of chance-related abilities
- `-a` or `-abil`
Add data of passive abilities
- `-t` or `-trait`
Add data of trait
- `-c` or `-cell`
Add data which required to be analyzed
- `-apk`
Use analyzed apk data, so that you won't need to send raw files tediously
- `-en/tw/kr/jp`
Decide BC version which you will use, it will be used only when `-apk` is turned on
enemyStatAnalyzer.tip:
This will be the most complicated command and requires basic knowledge of data mining, and access to BC files. I made bot able to handle new data which bot can't catch as possible as I can

Index starts from 0. This index here means index of values in stat file

Data set must be wrapped with {} (i.e. {1, Test Trait})

Arrays must be wrapped with [] (i.e. [1,2,3], [t,t,f])

If array requires boolean data, you don't need to put full `true` or `false`. Just put `t` for `true`, and `f` for `false`, so you can reduce command writing time

findStage.description: Try to search stage with specified filter data, and upload info of it
findStage.parameter:
- `-s`
Display info with seconds instead of frames
- `-f` or `-fr`
Display info with frames instead of seconds
- `-lv`
Apply level (new name of star) data
- `-c` or `-compact`
Compress multiple fields into one field so that mobile users can see stat without flooding the chat
- `-o` or `-or`
Activate `OR` operation
- `-a` or `-and`
Activate `AND` operation
- `-bg` or `-background`
Set background ID to filter with
- `-cs` or `-castle`
Set castle ID to filter with
- `-ms` or `-music`
Set music ID to filter with
- `-b` or `-boss`
Find the stage which contains boss
- `-m` or `-monthly`
Activate monthly mission filter mode
findStage.tip:
You can provide multiple enemies to filter with. To perform this, provide enemy names, separated with `/` separator. For example, if you want to provide 2 names; `Doge` and `Snache`, then what you will have to write is `Doge/Snache`. **You can provide only up to 5 enemies**

`Or` or `And` operation decides how bot will filter stage with provided enemy combinations. For example, if `Or` operation is activated, then bot will filter stage which contains this enemy **OR** that enemy. If it's `And` operation, then bot will filter stage which contains this enemy **AND** that enemy. `And` operation is turned on as default, and if you provide both `-o` and `-a` parameters, `-a` will have higher priority
findStage.tip2:
Crystal modifier can adjust status of crystal treasure. For example, you may have beaten only up to ItF Ch.2, so aliens in Ch.3 may have different magnification than full treasure. In this case, you can adjust crystal modifier by passing number of chapter that you finished

For example, if you are beating Itf Ch.1, then you can pass `-i0` parameter. If you are beating CotC Ch.3, then you can pass `-c2`, and so on

format.guide: 如果要更詳細的指令細節，請點上面的連結

hasRole.description: Find list of users who have specified role. Role must be offered as either mention or ID. **Only Moderators can use this command**

idSet.description: Manually customize role to allow these users to use specific commands
idSet.tip: If bot can't specially recognize server's structure, this server will have role called `PackPackMod`. Command which requires **Moderator** command will be able to be used only by users who have `PackPackMod` role at first until they manually set mod role id

integrate.description: Get integrated value by using numerical methods with provided formula and range
integrate.parameter:
- `-r` or `-range`
Define range, must be wrapped with square brackets (`[]`)
- `-s` or `-section`
Define number of section, must be wrapped with square brackets (`[]`)
- `-t` or `-trapezoidal`
Apply trapezoidal rule algorithm
- `-si` or `-simpson`
Apply Simpson's rule algorithm
- `-s38` or `-simpson38`
Apply Simpson's 3/8 rule algorithm
- `-b` or `-boole`
Apply Boole's rule algorithm
integrate.tip:
When you writing range, you have to wrap range with `[]` square brackets. For example, `[2, 3]`, `[-2, 10]`, etc. Also, you can put calculator functions as well, such as `[sqrt(2), 2 + ln(3)]`, `[3 * pi, 6 * pi]`, etc.
Same for number of section, such as `[25]`, `[3 * 30]`, etc. Max number of section is 1000

Bot provides 4 types of algorithm : Trapezoidal Rule, Simpson's Rule, Simpson's 3/8 Rule, Boole's Rule

Number of section must be multiples of 2 when using Simpson's Rule
Number of section must be multiples of 3 when using Simpson's 3/8 Rule
Number of sections must be multiple of 4 when using Boole's Rule

If algorithm isn't specified, it will perform Closed Newton-Cotes Rule
integrate.usage: `%sintegrate [Formula] [-r [Range Start, Range End]] <-s Number of Section> <Algorithm>`

registerScamLink.description: Register scam link to database which will be used to auto-moderate compromised users. This command can affect bot's moderating status, so **only allowed servers' moderators can use this command**
registerScamLink.tip:
If you are moderator who has permission, and somehow found this, **__don't use this command for fun__**

When registering scam link, try to register link's domain only. For example, if link is `http://something.com/someCode`, then domain will be `http://something.com/`, so you can exclude `someCode` part. This will help bot to moderate users more fluently

serverConfig.description: Adjust config of server, so bot can apply preferences automatically. **Only moderators can use this command**
serverConfig.tip:
When you call this command, bot will show 5 things which can be adjusted : Language, Default level, Extra information, Unit, Compact embed

**Language** - language is that you can make bot show text with difference supporting language

**Default level** - You can make bot apply specific level automatically without calling `-lv` parameter

**Extra information** - You can make bot always show extra information (catfruit evolve data for unit, ex stage data for stage, etc.) without calling `-e` parameter

**Unit** - You can make bot always use frame/second unit for time-related data automatically without calling `-s` parameter

**Compact embed** - In mobile discord, there's problem that bot floods the chat when showing stat embed. This config merges multiple fields into one field, compressing embed messages without calling `-c` parameter

solve.description: Find solution(s) for specified equation. Keep in mind that this isn't exact solution always, it approaches with numerical methods
solve.example:
`p!sv sin(x)` [3 solutions will be found]
`p!sv x - 2 = -x^2` [2 solutions will be found]
solve.parameter:
- `-n` or `-newton`
Use Newton-Raphson/Newton method algorithm
- `-b` or `-bisection`
Apply bisection method algorithm
- `-s` or `-secant`
Apply secant method algorithm
- `-f` or `-false`
Apply false position method algorithm
- `-r` or `-range`
Apply range for finding solutions
- `-i` or `-iteration`
Define how many times bot will perform repeated-calculations
- `-e` or `-error`
Define what margin error will be that will make bot stop repeated-calculations
solve.tip:
Bot provides 4 numerical methods to perform root finding; Newton-Raphson Method, Bisection Method, Secant Method, False Position Method. Keep in mind that algorithm can diverge depending on situations

Maximum iteration is limited as 100. 0% margin error is allowed, but most of time, it will fail to reach this error. If neither error nor iteration are defined, it will follow 0.001% default margin error

You can pass `f(x) = g(x)` format, or `f(x)` only. If only `f(x)` is passed, then it will assume `f(x) = 0`

stageStatAnalyzer.description: Analyze stats of stage from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings qutie heavy process and requires basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command**
stageStatAnalyzer.parameter:
- `-m` or `-mid`
Decide ID of map, for example, 1278, 2180, etc.
- `-c` or `-code`
Decide code of map, such as `S`, `C`, etc.
- `-s` or `-second`
Use second unit
- `-n` or `-name`
Decide custom name of stages
- `-lv`
Set level of these stages
- `-en/tw/kr/jp`
Decide BC version which you will use
- `-r` or `-range`
Decide which stages you will analyze specifically
stageStatAnalyzer.tip:
This analyzer uses apk file automatically unlike other analyzers due to its complexity

Map ID here isn't just index of map collection. Each map collection code has their own numeric value. For example, code `S` is 1000, `E` is 4000, etc. You have to include this numeric code value, so that ID's format becomes `Code value + Index value`

If code is same with map code of Gauntlet Stage (RA), or Collaboration Gauntlet Stage (CA), it will generate 10s stages only (1, 11, 21, ..., and max)

When deciding range of stage that will be analyzed, you can pass stage ID, with `,` (i.e. `1, 2, 4`). Or, you can perform range with `-` (i.e. `1-3, 4-6`). For example, combination of these two will be `1, 3, 5-8, 10`, then bot will analyze only stage `1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10`

statAnalyzer.active:
Format : `{indexArray, format, isTimeUnitArray, ignoreIndex} <intArray, string, booleanArray, int>`

 - ignoreIndex is the index of element which will be checked. If you want to check 1st element, then pass this as `0`. If specified element in array is 0, then bot will consider this unit doesn't have ability, so it won't add description about this data. This is for preventing `0% chance to ...`

 - isTimeUnitArray decides whether specific index of element is time unit (Data which has to be displayed with frame/second unit). If you passed [t, f] as data, when bot writing ability description about first data, it will write data with frame or second data

 - To put data of indexArray into text, you have to wrap with underscores (_), for example, if you want to put 1st data of indexArray, put `_0_`, 2nd will be `_1_`, and so on. For example, if data is [1,2] and you wrote text as `_0_% chance to do for _1_`, then result will be `1% chance to do for 2`
statAnalyzer.additionalDescription:
This embed message explains detailed explanation of each parameter. Below is which types of variable you can put

- `int`
Integer, aka number
- `string`
String, aka sentence, words, etc
- `boolean`
Boolean. You can put only true or false for this type of variable, bot accepts `t` as true, and `f` as false
- `array`
Data which can hold several elements. For example, if you want to put 2 elements, write like `[N₀, N₁]` where Nₓ are numbers or booleans you want to put
- `intArray`
Array, but requires only integer as elements
- `booleanArray`
Array, but requires only boolean as elements
statAnalyzer.cell:
Format : `{indexArray, name, isTimeUnit, oneLine, ignoreZero} <intArray, string, boolean, boolean, boolean>`

 - oneLine decides whether this cell data will be isolated from other data as single line or not

 - ignoreZero decides whether bot will exclude 0 numbers or not. For example, if data is [4, 5, 0] and ignoreZero is true, then bot will display data as `4, 5`. If not, `4, 5, 0` directly
statAnalyzer.description: Analyze stats of unit(s) from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings quite heavy process and required basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command**
statAnalyzer.example: `p!sa -u 613 -l 2 -s -lv 50 -n Yamii, Yaminoir -c {[0], Test Data, false, false, false} -t {0, Test Trait} -p {[0, 1, 2], _0_% chance to do something to _1_ for _2_, [f, f, t], 0}`
statAnalyzer.name: You can decide names of this unit manually, or it will just use this unit's ID (i.e. `123-000`). You can pass several names by separating them with comma (`,`). For example, `Yamii, Yaminoir`, etc
statAnalyzer.parameter:
- `-u` or `-uid`
Decide ID of unit
- `-l` or `-len`
Decide number of forms of this unit
- `-s` or `-second`
Use second unit
- `-n` or `-name`
Decide custom name of this unit, must provide same number with number of forms. `,` is separator
- `-lv`
Set level of this unit
- `-p` or `-proc`
Add data of chance-related abilities
- `-a` or `-abil`
Add data of passive abilities
- `-t` or `-trait`
Add data of trait
- `-c` or `-cell`
Add data which required to be analyzed
- `-apk`
Use analyzed apk data, so that you won't need to send raw files tediously
- `-en/tw/kr/jp`
Decide BC version which you will use, it will be used only when `-apk` is turned on
statAnalyzer.passive:
Format : `{index, text} <int, string>`

Use this parameter when bot can't handle specific new passive ability
statAnalyzer.tip:
This will be the most complicated command and requires basic knowledge of data mining, and access to BC files. I made bot able to handle new data which bot can't catch as possible as I can

Index starts from 0. This index here means index of values in stat file

Data set must be wrapped with {} (i.e. {1, Test Trait})

Arrays must be wrapped with [] (i.e. [1,2,3], [t,t,f])

If array requires boolean data, you don't need to put full `true` or `false`. Just put `t` for `true`, and `f` for `false`, so you can reduce command writing time
statAnalyzer.trait:
Format : `{index, name} <int, string>`

Use this parameter when bot can't handle specific new trait

subscribeScamLinkDetector.description: Subscribe to feature of bot, which detects scam link automatically and auto-moderate users who sent links. **Only moderators can use this command**. `ssld` or
subscribeScamLinkDetector.parameter:
- `-m`
Decide mute role. Must be provided with its raw numeric ID
subscribeScamLinkDetector.tip:
This feature was made to establish scam link database, and help moderators to moderate compromised accounts. Moderators can choose 3 kinds of action for them : 

 - Mute
 - Kick (Need reconsidering)
 - Ban (Not recommended)

Moderators must provide mute role ID via `-m` parameter if they want to choose mute action. If bot could catch compromised account and if this user is in this server, it will report user to specified report channel. Moderators also can decide to make bot upload info about those who aren't in server as well

Be aware that don't rely on this bot too much. It can do false moderation to users, so too strong action such as ban may lead to bad situation

announcement.description: You can manage announcement feature here. Assign channel to make bot post announcements in there. If channel is announcement channel, you can also make bot publish the message too. For additional message, it's similar like event data's additional message, but little bit different. Bot has two types of announcements : Important or Non-Important. If we have mentions in the additional message, bot will directly mention target for important announcements. But for non-important announcements, bot will send the additional message as silent message. Users will see mention on the server icon, but they won't get notification

boosterPin.description: You can manage the channels where boosters can pin the message or not. Select channel in select menu to assign the channel so that boosters can pin the message there. Or select assigned channel in 2nd select menu to remove them. Unlike status channel manager, you can add as many channels as you want. You can either allow boosters to have pin permission in all channels, or specific channels only

announcement.description: Bot has capability to send an announcement in assigned channel. Similar like event data feature, you can also make bot send additional message
announcement.title: ### %s Announcement Channel

boosterPin.description: This is very minor feature, but for moderators who want to give perks to members who boosted the server, you can achieve pin permission **without message manage permission**. Idea is simple, you can allow boosters to use command which makes bot pin message instead. This way moderators can allow boosters to have pin permission only, as well as controllability of which channels boosters will be able to pin/unpin messages
boosterPin.title: ### %s Booster Pin Channel

eventData.description: Bot can detect new event data automatically, and post newly found data in specific channel. You can also make bot send additional message for each BC version as well
eventData.title: ### %s Event Data

status.description: Bot isn't always online. It can go offline due to update, bug fix, or any reason. If this happens, members may wonder why it's offline. For this situation, you can make bot send status of it. It will send message whenever it will go offline (Unexpectedly going offline can't be handled), and send message again when it becomes online
status.title: ### %s Status Channel

channelPermission.description: You can manage channel permission for each assigned role here. First, select the role that you want to manage
channelPermission.selectRole: Select Role To Manage Channel Permission

role.description:
You can manage channel permission for role %s here. You can select channel in 1st select menu to add them into the channel list. Let's say you want to allow members to use commands only in `#A`. Then you can select `#A` in the select menu, then bot will start to force members to use commands only in that channel. Add more channels to allow members to use commands in several places. Select channel same channel again to remove that channel from the list. If you want to allow all channels, click `Allow All Channels` button (This will reset all your channel permission setting for this role!). If you want to allow no channels for this role, click `Disallow All Channels`

For interaction between other roles, bot will gather all the channels from roles that specific member has. For example, if member has `role A`, and `role B`, and if `role A` has permission in `#Channel-1`, and `role B` has permission in `#Channel-2`, this member will be able to use commands in both `#Channel-1` and `#Channel-2`

compactEmbed.description: Displaying stats may have problem in mobile that embed is too long, so it clogs the chat. For moderators who hate this problem, you can compress the information as much as possible, achieving smaller embed size. Keep in mind that such compressed information may look confusing and cluttered
compactEmbed.title: ### %s Compacted Embed Mode : %s

defaultLevel.description:
Default level is the level which is used for displaying unit stats. If members didn't specify level value, bot will use this level as default level. For example, if you set default level as %d, and call `p!fs Immortal Yukimura`, bot will display %d level Yukimura's stats. If unit has lower max level cap than set value (i.e. Metal Cat), bot will sue max cap level instead automatically

**Cats with basic rarity will ignore this setting, this applies same to Li'l units**
defaultLevel.title: ### %s Default Level : %d

defaultUnit.description: Without specifying parameter (`-s` or `-f`) for any commands that displays time-related information, bot will display them with `%s` unit. For example, any information such as foreswing, respawn time will be displayed as value like %s
defaultUnit.title: ### %s Display Unit : %s

embed.description: Advanced embed setting allows server managers to dynamically decide which extra information will be displayed altogether with essential stat information for unit/enemy/stage
embed.title: ### %s Advanced Embed Setting

extra.description: Some information such as unit's true form cost, additional information about stage is hidden until member passes `-e` parameter to the command. This is because such information is minor and rather only takes place in the embed. However, if moderators want rich information regardless, you can make bot always show extra information
extra.title: ### %s Show Extra Information : %s

forceCompact.description: Even though compacted embed mode is turned on in this server, bot still puts higher priority to personal preferences, so if member has compacted embed mode off, bot will display long embed again. To prevent this problem, moderators can force others to use compacted embed mode. This doesn't affect each users' preferences, so don't worry
forceCompact.title: ### %s Force Users to Use Compacted Embed Mode : %s

forceTreasure.description: As stated in page 1, bot puts higher priority to personal preferences. So member may have different treasure setting from full treasure, leading to potential confusion in discussion among members. You can force all members to use full treasure setting, removing such problems. Again, this doesn't affect each member's personal preferences
forceTreasure.title: ### %s Force Full Treasure : %s

treasure.description: Bot has capability to display information with consideration of treasure. Instead of members calculating every value manually, bot will display both value without treasure, and with treasure. For example, for red enemies, with assumption that we have full treasure, massive damage ability will have 4x multiplier towards them. Then unit's attack value, and DPS will get changed as well. Bot has capability to show such information
treasure.title: ### %s Treasure Display : %s

trueFormSearch.description: Most of time, true form unit has more superior stats than any other form. So members may want to directly see true form information only. For example, searching `Jizo` will make bot show all 3 forms of same unit, and members will have to manually select 3rd form. To change this, moderators can activate true form search mode. This will make bot always find true form only. If there's no true form for unit, then ti will search 2nd form instead too, applied same to ultra forms
trueFormSearch.title: ### %s True Form Search Mode : %s

commandBan.description: You can ban or unban members from using the commands. Reason can be anything. If member keeps spamming the commands, interrupting the discussion or clogging the chat, you can just prevent them from using any bot's commands. Select user in the select menu to ban them. Select already banned user again to unban them. Bot and yourself can't be banned of course

eventData.cantTalk: Bot can't talk in this channel! Please select other channel
eventData.description:
You can subscribe to event data post here. Select channel, then bot will automatically post event data in there. If you want to unsubscribe, unselect the channel from select menu. There are 2 methods for sorting event data : By Date, or By Raw Data Order. Sorting by date will make bot post event data with order of date when event starts. Sorting by raw data order will post event data with order of what Ponos has posted internally. Normally sorting by raw data order will make some events grouped together, but regardless of when each events start

For additional message, bot will send another message with what moderator has set for this BC version. Keep in mind that if event data is small enough, bot won't send additional message together

prefix.description: Moderators also can allow users to make bot recognize the command with server's own prefix. For example, currently `%s` is global prefix which everyone can use it in any servers. If you set server's prefix as `.`, then users will be able to call bot's commands with `.` as well, not only `%s`. **Keep in mind that this applies only to this server, it doesn't affect anything to users' personal preferences**

documentation.description: You can register or unregister roles here. This will make bot able to recognize specific roles properly, or the way that moderators prefer

booster.description: This optional role can be used when you want to allow boosters to have their own custom role or emoji only when they boosted your server (Form of perks). Or, you can allow them to pin message even without message managing permission. Just in case, bot allows any role to be actual *booster role*, decision is on to moderators
booster.title: ### %s Booster Role : %s

member.description: Member role is basic role that will allow moderators to control any members' permission overall. If you don't select any roles in the list below, bot will allow everyone to use the commands, otherwise members are required to have registered role to use them
member.title: ### %s Member Role : %s

moderator.description: Moderator role is crucial role for the bot because bot has commands which only moderators can use, and these commands can decide how bot will function. If you don't assign any roles, owner of the server or any users who have server manager permission, or administrator permission will be able to use moderator-only commands
moderator.title: ### %s Moderator Role : %s

channelPermission.description: For the case when moderators want members to use commands only in specific channels, this feature is the one. You can allow or disallow users to use commands of the bot in any channels
channelPermission.title: ### %s Channel Permission

commandBan.description: If member abuses the commands, or spams them, moderators can temporarily ban user from using this bot's commands
commandBan.title: ### %s Ban User From Using Commands

permissionBan.description: Similar like scenario above, but if moderators don't want complete ban from using commands, they can temporarily disable channel permission, preventing member from using commands in some channels
permissionBan.title: ### %s Manage Channel Permission For User

prefixBan.description: If moderators want to disable bot's custom prefix feature for this server, moderators can either completely disallow users from using their custom prefix, or assign specific prefix that will be banned from being used
prefixBan.title: ### %s Manage Disallowed Prefix

permissionBan.description: You can manage which channel permission specific member will have. First, please select the member you want to manage

user.description: You can manage which channel permission %s will have. Normally member will always have all channel permissions from each roles. However, let's assume that member starts to abuse commands in `#Channel-A` because of `Role 1`'s channel permission. Instead of banning member from using bot's commands as whole, you can just deactivate `Role 1`'s channel permission for this user only. Bot will list roles that this member has, and also are assigned into the bot. You can select that role to deactivate channel permission of that role from user or re-activate it again

prefixBan.description: This bot allows users to assign their own custom prefix that will make bot recognize users. However, since there are a lot of bots in Discord platform, sometimes there can be situation where user's custom prefix and other bots' prefix are same. This will result in conflicts. User can trigger this bot and another bot at the same time, and they may abuse this, leading to spamming problem. Moderators can disable custom prefix for this feature by clicking the switch button below. Or, if disabling as whole sounds too harsh, moderators can assign prefix that will be ignored only in this server. Users will be notified via DM if user had disallowed prefix as their custom prefix
prefixBan.remove: Select prefix to allow it back

modal.description: Type prefix that will be disallowed here
modal.title: Prefix Disallow

status.description: You can manage status channel where bot will post notification whenever bot goes offline or online under developer's maintenance. This means that unexpectedly being offline (i.e. Server power out) can't be handled still, but bot will send notification message when it comes online back. You can assign multiple channels for this. This is for making bot able to send status message in the several channels, reaching users as much as possible. The limit is up to %d channels. Select channel select menu to assign channels. Select assigned channel to remove them in the 2nd select menu
